replies.body:
Two types of responses in this thread: Folks clearly identifying this as inting, and folks sarcastically calling it a "bad game" because they think "Riot fanboys" can't admit when somebody is feeding.

Yes, 22 deaths and 2 cs in 19 minutes is 100% intentional feeding. No question.
Clearly he had a bad game.

22 deaths, 2 cs and 2 items 

Harvey Dent approves!

https://vignette.wikia.nocookie.net/marvel_dc/images/2/26/Two_Face_%28Nolanverse%29.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20110813194104
With 2 CS. Yes. You really have to try to be that bad.

Yes

Even during a bad game, a player should have more than 2 CS.
He aslo doesn't have smite.

I suggest submitting the original screenshot to support via a ticket
I have games playing support mages and I end up with more than 2Cs trying NOT to take any farm lol. Theres no excuse for a JG to have 2cs unless they DCd

> [{quoted}](name=Mordius,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=iyKer37t,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2018-01-30T19:19:06.001+0000)
>
> Yes
> 
> Even during a bad game, a player should have more than 2 CS.
> He aslo doesn't have smite.
> 
> I suggest submitting the original screenshot to support via a ticket

He is a support skarner. 

His death count is so high because he is sacrificing himself for the team.

He is truly an hero.
So, very off topic, but what did you do to cover up player names? It looks super clean, especially the bottom one. (also yea, looks like inting)

Looks like they took a selection of the empty spot on the right then copied and stretched it so that it covered the summoner names. Would make sense for the bottom one as well since they would have copied a dark portion of the mountain background.
Maybe? The reason I asked is that the portion under the mountains is the correct darkness, which the left and right sides don't look like they have. I could be wrong tho.

I don't remember the name but there's a tool in some photo edit softwares that smudges the picture by taking the colors and moving over while copying them. The mountains above the red team score show that it may have just been OP copying a section of the background picture he found on Google, pasting it, and adding a brighter bar for his line.
Photoshop maybe?
That's a program, this is a tool.
The bigger issue is that you didnt dodge when you saw a jgler without smite, and that you or your troll teamates didnt open **immediately** and ff at 15 if the enmy dint finish by then.
one int feeder can stop a whole team from ffing at 15 min. you need a 5 man majority to FF that early.
Yes but if the 4 of you stood in the fountain, they would've ended before 15
That's true, but you may also get reported for afking yourself at that point.
not if you like move around some minimal amount
the game can tell if you dont leave base and youll still get a valid report for afk if someone reports you

> [{quoted}](name=sleepysithlord,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=iyKer37t,comment-id=000b0000000000000000,timestamp=2018-01-30T21:35:10.706+0000)
>
> not if you like move around some minimal amount

This is actually one of the reasons the "Leaving the game/AFK" option is available in the report section. Is because people will attempt to beat the LeaverBuster by walking around in fountain so that they aren't "AFK."

1 per 2 minutes is inting imo.

He reached over 1 per minute

Can we not assign arbitrary KDA requirements to determine intent?

It works in this situation, because 22 deaths in 19 minutes isn't even possible without intentional feeding, and if you check the match history, we can clearly see that they're running it down mid. But a bronze top laner paired with a gold/plat, giving it their all but still dying ten times in a twenty-minute stomp, doesn't magically turn into intentional feeding.
At a death every 2 minutes you don't even have time to lane before you die again.
This. But sadly I've reported multiple players for this kind of death rate, and 0 punishment. Lovin' it. Great system, Riot.

Dude, downvote me all you want, but real int feeders slip through the cracks because Riot's too busy sifting through folks reporting noobs for making bad decisions and having bad games. 

Nobody is rationally going to defend OP's example of an intentional feeder, but in most cases, KDA only tells part of the story.

Int feeders "slip through the cracks" because Riot and this board don't seem to realize that you can int without buying tears/mobis and running down mid. Anybody who wants to int and not get caught will easily be covered by "just a bad game" if they avoid doing that.

Therefore, whenever someone reports someone who is inting, but not in the blatantly obvious cases that the system can detect, those reports are the "bad decisions" and "bad games" you are referring to.

You're going off of an average of one death every two minutes.  That doesn't mean that they died at precisely two minutes each time.  Keep in mind, certain champions have ways to get back to lane faster than others (i.e. riven dashes, jayce gate, etc), and once a champion who is behind gets back to lane, especially if they teleported back and immediately died again, they are going to be extremely far behind and likely to lose the turret.  Unless the enemy is purposefully keeping the tower up to deny them exp, which you don't see much at lower ranks, the enemy is going to be getting closer to their respawn with every death, which will just make it faster for them to die again.

If you are going to lane, dying. Respawning going to lane dying.  Respawning going to lane dying,  and STILL trying to fight them,  You are intentionally putting yourself in a feeding situation. They're are degrees of inting

Perhaps, but it's hardly black and white. We've all had situations where we're behind, doing our best to farm, and just keep getting caught, especially when there's a discrepancy in movement abilities in the matchup. Say you're losing top lane to a Yasuo, and you're a standard juggernaut-type. Even trying to stay within XP range, let alone continuing to farm, risks letting that Yasuo just dash on over to you and delete you. 

Barring lag or other exceptional circumstances, you're always "intentionally" doing what you're doing. Bad positioning, poor choices, and lack of skill are all the products of "intentional" behavior, but you can't equate that with intentional feeding.
What the shit comp was that.  Support skarner?

Cait/Xerath bot, Kassadin mid, Irelia top, Skarner jungle.

I'm more intrigued about why you couldn't figure out their team comp than the comp itself. However, it doesn't matter and I digress.
Uh, I don't even care what this person's KDA is, they only have 2 cs in 20 minutes.  That only is pretty damning.

You were there I assume....was it?  They didn't take smite, so was it one of those games where they were TRYING to clear jg without it or duo top or something...and they could just never get going?  BUt they still tried to gank the lanes and failed every time because they were behind?

OR did they actually just keep walking straight into the enemy to die?
100% running it down mid, judging by the graphic in match history.

LOL.
Yeah, that's intentional.
Regardless, hope you enjoyed your -19 LP.

Riots system is so fair.

Why is this even a discussion?

22 deaths.  2 CS.  2 items.

What is there to discuss?  The kid was obviously inting.  Why is this even here?  Submit a support ticket on his troll ass, and move on with your life.
100% inting.
Interesting

> [{quoted}](name=SirBlues,realm=EUW,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=iyKer37t,comment-id=00040000,timestamp=2018-01-30T19:49:52.244+0000)
>
> Interesting

**INT**eresting
I didn't look at anything here, but from Rito's perspective its obviously just a bad game.
Nah he's just having a bad game playing some new meta ghost tp jungle game. Stop being a toxic flamer dude!
Some of us Skarner players trying really hard and well to bring the dude up to good stats. Then there's this guy smh
Nah, he's playing skarner. Seems about right.

Depends on the context. Was he having severe lag issues? Is this his first time playing league? Did he accidentally rewire his game setup and never noticed? Did he take the wrong summoner spells, runes and champ? 

Remember, as long as it wasn't intentional it is not inting.

you can't have a "first time playing league" and be in ranked.

Rewiring your game-setup accidentally?
"Oh sorry we lost I Accidentally hooked up my Mouse+keyboard to my Xbox..."
{{sticker:zombie-brand-mindblown}} 

Even with wrong summoner spells, runes, and wrong champ there is no excuse(besides someone inting) to have 2 CS in a game that runs over 20 minutes.

Even if the keyboard wasn't working, abilities can be used with the MOUSE which leaves no excuse for 2 CS in over 20 minutes.

> [{quoted}](name=MuffledGarbage,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=iyKer37t,comment-id=00120000,timestamp=2018-01-31T19:32:25.788+0000)
>
>
> Even with wrong summoner spells, runes, and wrong champ there is no excuse(besides someone inting) to have 2 CS in a game that runs over 20 minutes.
> 

He is support skarner.
Most definitely, regardless of context.
He was just having a bad game. Everyone has bad games.
